name: Le Livre Disparu
description:
"Le Livre Disparu" is an interactive book developed as a point-and-click and is played on a PC.

This game is a 3D adaptation of the universe created by Coline Thomson in the eponymous book.
The player plays as Peter, a young boy living in a library where you can find all the books in the world.
This particular library becomes alive every night when everyone is asleep.
From then on, the books become buildings or shops, living places of a multitude of strange little characters like Peter.
After finding the sheet of the book "How to Live Forever", Peter decided to go in search of this book.
Thanks to the player, Peter must identify, seek and reach the means of transport that allow him to move forward in the library.
 
This game is a 3rd year project of the 3D Drawing training of the Émile Cohl School, it was produced by Océane Forêt; the music was composed by Jérôme Yven.

Océane Forêt: https://oceaneforet.wixsite.com/portfolio
Jérôme Yven: https://www.jeromeyven.com/
